title: Kernel crashing on Apple M1 and Docker Desktop 4.5.0
body:
<!--
Thanks for reporting a bug 🙌 ❤️

Before opening a new issue, please make sure that we do not have any duplicates already open. You can ensure this by searching the issue list for this repository. If there is a duplicate, please close your issue and add a comment to the existing issue instead. Also, be sure to check our documentation first: https://github.com/ml-tooling/ml-workspace
-->

**Describe the bug:**

Started the image and tried to import TF into a new notebook. Kernel keeps crashing and it tries to recover but crashes again.

Command executed:

import tensorflow as tf

tf.__version__

**Expected behaviour:**

Do not crash and run the code

**Steps to reproduce the issue:**

Install docker for Apple Silicon

Get latest version of ml-workspace

Start the instance

Open Browser (Safari or Chrome) and navigate to localhost:8080

Open existing notebook / create a new one 

Execute the following command:

import tensorflow as tf

tf.__version__

**Technical details:**

- Workspace version <!-- run `echo $WORKSPACE_VERSION` inside the workspace -->: 0.13.2
- Docker version <!-- run `docker version` on host machine -->: Docker Desktop for Apple M1 4.5.0, Engine Version: 20.10.12
- Host Machine OS (Windows/Linux/Mac): Mac 12.3
- Command used to start the workspace <!-- e.g. `docker run mltooling/ml-workspace:latest` -->: docker run -p 8080:8080 --name "ml-workspace" --shm-size 512m mltooling/ml-workspace
- Browser (Chrome/Firefox/Safari): Chrome and Safari

**Possible Fix:**

<!--- Not obligatory, but suggest a fix or reason for the bug -->

**Additional context:**

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->
